short_description: Output the baseform (lemma) of the input words/phrases.
long_description: Lemmatization is a basic text analysis tool that determines the lemmas (standard forms) of words, so that all forms of a word can be grouped together, improving the accuracy of text analysis. The TextMorph function implements a lemmatization algorithm based on the WordNet 3.0 dictionary, which is packaged with the function. If an input word is in the dictionary, the function outputs its morphs with their parts of speech; otherwise, the function outputs the input word itself and sets its part of speech to NULL. When an input word has multiple morphs, the function outputs them in order of the precedence of their parts of speech: noun, verb, adj, and adv. That is, if an input word has a noun form, it is listed first. If the same word has a verb form, it is listed next, and so on.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The input table that contains the input words/phrases.
input_tables.description: The input table that contains the input words/phrases.

argument_clauses.name: WordColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the words.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the words.

argument_clauses.name: POSTagColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the part-of-speech (POS) tags of thewords, generated by the function.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the part-of-speech (POS) tags of the words, output by the function POSTagger. If you specify this argument, the function outputs each morph according to its POS tag.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: SingleOutput
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to output only one morph for each word. The default value is 'true'. If you specify 'false', the function outputs all morphs for each word.
argument_clauses.description: Specify whether to output only one morph for each word. If you specify 'false', the function outputs all morphs for each word. Default: 'true'

argument_clauses.name: POS
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the parts of speech to output. A pos can be 'noun', 'verb', 'adj', or 'adv'. Specification order is irrelevant; the order of precedence is: 'noun', 'verb', 'adj', 'adv'. By default, the function outputs all parts of speech. If you specify this argument and SingleOutput ('true'), then the function outputs only the first pos. Note: The function does not determine the part of speech of the word from its context, it uses all possible parts of speech for the word in the dictionary.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the parts of speech to output. A pos can be 'noun', 'verb', 'adj', or 'adv'. Specification order is irrelevant; this is the order of precedence: 'noun', 'verb', 'adj', 'adv'. If you specify this argument and SingleOutput ('true'), then the function outputs only the first pos. Note: The function does not determine the part of speech of the word from its context, it uses all possible parts of speech for the word in the dictionary. Default: All parts of speech

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
